Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Very peaceful location, it is from 100 Km from Anuradhapura city. You have travel through A14 road and turn. When you enter the property, you have to enter your details on the security book. Remember to remove your shoes when entering to the main building. You can purchase candles from the shop next to the church.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: A very old catholic shrine in Sri Lanka. Someone bares similar resemblance to Lourdes. Lovely to see the different cultures in Sri Lanka

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: This is one of the oldest shrines in Sri Lanka located close to Mannar . Very peaceful and a must visit when you visit this part of the country .

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: This is a old popular Catholic Church in Srilanka. During the feast lots of pilgrims visit this Church from all over the world.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Title: Oh! what a change in the surroundings after nearly five decades
Review Text: The surrounding area of the church has become very much urbanised. I can still recall the woodland like surroundings and the forest beyond when I last visited the holy shrine in early seventies. On this occasion, the time we visited the shrine was almost midday and it had less pilgrims thus providing us with an easy access.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: No word to express how I feel about this location which is filled with all kind of blessings from our lady Madhu. We were lucky to visit and participate with feast held at Madhu shrine this time of the year and we are hoping to visit our lady Madhu on August. Thank you Amma.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: A visit to the Madhu shrine is the main attraction in the area and of great religious significance to Catholics.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Title: Calm place for worship to Our Lady of Madhu.
Review Text: Turn off to the church from the Madawachchiya-Mannar road. 10 kim to the shrine from the turn off. Signs well posted, so you cannot miss it. Early morning masses daily. Sunday masses are held till 11.30 am.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Title: Main Catholic Church in Sri Lanka
Review Text: The major Catholic Church in Sri Lanka. People visit this place with so much faith and they believe that miraculous things happens after worshiping at this place. Non Catholics also can visit the place and experience the church and how the Catholics do their prayers. The church is located in dense jungle and survived the civil war which lasted for 3 decades. Now the access roads are very well built.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Most Secret miraculous Holy place. You will receive what ever you ask for from Our lady of Madhu. Praise the lord!!!

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: September is a great month to visit the Madhu Shrine. Lovely weather. Rainy in the evening and sunny in the morning. Large number of devotees present BUT not crowded. We were able to hear Bi-lingual Mass, pray at the shrines and chapel. Natural Bees Honey available right along the main road. However, prices must be researched prior to visit to ensure a good bargain. Our wish to spot a straying Sloth Bear along the main road did not materialize. Area residents say its a common happening. Very Good visit.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Visited en-route to Sigiriya, This is place of significance for Catholics mainly. but people from other religious beliefs also visit. A place of pilgrimage where people go to pray for miracles / blessings. This church is dedicated to Mother Mary

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: What do you want in your life go and ask the mother Mary with in 12 months your life will be in a beyond your expectations. Just try once to visit and ask from mother mary

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Cars are not allowed in, but for the disabled, a wheelchair was provided so that access to the church wasn't difficult. Masses are said frequently, and we were able to stay for a service.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: This is place of significance for Catholics mainly. Its well maintained and run by the Catholic Church. A place of pilgrimage where people go to pray for miracles / blessings.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Good for those who believe. Can get very crowded. Specially during festivals and Sundays. People of all walks of life and  come here

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Madhu is a mystic jungle shrine dedicated to Mother Mary That day is most beautiful day in my life because my husband was also with me itâ€™s a great moment and the place is very beautiful lot of peoples in praying the mother marry I like the day and a day Iâ€™ll never forget in my life time Sry my English not good I think just ok any mistake plz forgive me

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Madhu church has long held a fascination for Sri Lankans, mainly for Catholics but also for those of other faiths as well. I first visited more than 50 years ago with my parents and siblings. In those days, the drive, in a car without air conditioning or power steering, on a rutted road, took more than two days. We made overnight stops at Kalaoya and Aâ€™pura. The trip was dangerous, because from Puttalam, we traveled through thick forest, inhabited by elephants, leopard, and bear. We recited the rosary and sang hymns. The forest is gone now, except for the reservation around the shrine. The shrine itself was damaged during the civil war, but has been lovingly restored by the army. Itâ€™s a beautiful structure. The area can be very crowded during the various feasts throughout the year, but on the weekday I visited, hardly 20 visitors were around. Accomodation consits of small houses built by families, which they occupy during visits, but are rented out by the shrine authoritiies to other visitors when they are vacant. I was disaapointed to see that these houses appared to be in a state of neglect. I certainly wouldnâ€™t  think of staying overnight at one of these houses. Instead, at stayed at the Palmyrah Garden Hotel, which I have reviewed on Tripadvisor. The shrine is well worth a visit. The roads, all the way from Colombo, are excellent.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: This is a very popular church here in Srilanka. For the annual festival Catholics from all over Srilanka come here.A beautiful church.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: The toilet facilities were utterly horrible and soured my experience of the church, which I had wanted to visit for a very long time.  Such a busy church to provide facilities so bad is totally demeaning to the worshippers.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Must visit place for all Religious people. Huge area where you can see the Shrine of our Lady. Madhu church festival held during August which draw a large crowd.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: I hope that all  tourist who visit Sri Lanka , make it a point to visit the Holy Shrine of our Lady of Madhu, no matter what religion you are as I'm sure you will get the blessing from this most Holy Church, This is a Church that your prayers are answered. But all devotees must understand that this is a Holy place and you must behave you best and dress decently ,,,, and you must respect our most Holy Mother as she will never fail you ! Hope that all reading this will make visit to this Holy Shrine if you still haven"t as its a worth thing in your life ! Please do go and get your blessing, as no matter from what religion or country we are, but we are all human ,,, I'm sure you will have no regrets ,, God Bless you all !!

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Mother Maryâ€™s blessing is a wonderful feeling and the life changing trip always with a 21 days vegetarian fasting to giving thanks to marudha madu madha. Love you mama always keep praying for us. See you soon

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: This is a must see church. From the minute you walk in you feel warm and happy. Miracles would surely occur here you can feel the presence of God.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: visit this place 1st time. near the ca park theres a wash room. didn't go there. not clean. with in car park  need to walk around 300 m to enter the church. it has a notice remove shoes , wear properly , remove caps. we enter the church &see around. most of the people are parrying in side the church. better keep in silence. madhu church is famous for the cure diseases. & we rest there around 10 mints & look around.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: A very famous religious place for Catholics. Access road to the church is excellent. A must visit place place if you are in Mannar district.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: A place to see without fail.  A very good canteen to eat.  Can buy religious items at the church premises.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Well known sacred place of catholics not only in Sri Lanka, but all over the world. Peace and quite area.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: A must visit place for all Catholics. It is a place where you feel the warmth of Mother Mary and gives you tremendous inner peace. You just feel like staying on in the Shrine for ever and ever.... Please remember this is a pilgrimage and dress decently and do not couple with fun. Time to give your phones a break. Unfortunately some travel for fun.... Our Lady of Madhu - Pray For Us.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: a place of history and culture for Christians and the statue of mother mary which is supposed to have washed ashore is being kept here.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: This is a Powerful Church, and you feel very comfortable when you get there,,,, You must make the best of of your Pilgrimage by attending the mass and getting the blessing of our Lord and Holy Mother,   You do get small houses or rooms and its your choice to get what you like,,,,, This time we did get a good guest house just at the entrance to Madhu ,, its just a  short drive to the church,,, this place is just nice and comfortable as well,,A/C rooms etc,,, We just want to get the Blessing of our Lord and Blessed Holy Moth, which we do every year! My son and daughter  [ in law ] take us every year !  God Bless them and our families,,,, I like to ask any of you who have not gone to this Hly place to make sure you do,,, Never mind what religion you are! You will get the Blessing of our Holy Mother!  Miracles do work,! God bless you all.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: It was very charming experience to be there, it was a church located in woods my suggestion is every catholic must visit the church for worship

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: So much peace and calm can be obtained here.  Just sit in front of the shrine and meditate.  Very miraculous, you must promise to return again to give thanks. Sadly there is no mid day mass on week days, so if you deicide to visit on a weekday just for the day the mass is early morning only.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: The church is a very simple design.  It's beautiful to walk around. Our Lady of Madhu is a small but delicate statute at the head of the church. There is a cafe to eat at the church serving ok food (curry and rice) which is cheap ($6.80 for 4 people). The toilets are however the worst I have ever come across. I cannot imagine how much worse it would be during the August festival with throngs of people.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: in upcountry or in fortresses of southern province i found churches with amazing architectural designs but here it isn't the church which takes the eye. and there are locals who travelled many miles to reach it and now sleeping inside and outside and its very ugly. ðŸ˜‚

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Though this shrine is venerated by the catholic community, its known to attract believers of other religious faiths too

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: A must go place for all faithful, lots of Pilgrims visit this place annually and supposedly has many miracles.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: A venerated Catholic church to Our Lady. Feast celebrated in August which draws huge numbers of pilgrims.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: The jungle shrine has recently undergone indiscriminate garish treatment and it is now kitsch and commercialized. There is fare distance to walk from the car park road closure to the shrine. Sad to see it in this condition, stripped of its former charm and sanctity.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: During festivals, very busy & active but no proper/clean wash room facilities. We travelled further up towards north & stayed in a little guest hose in Manar

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: we have been here to Madhu church several times. Very good place as facilities been arranged by the church. Very powerful miraculous place among Christians.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: The Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu or simply the Madhu Church as the locals used to call it, is the most popular catholic church in the island. A beautiful place. Its history spans more than 400 years and in August, when the annual feast of the church is on, the place is very much populated with local pilgrims. During the other times a nice and quiet place.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: This is quite a famous place for Catholics and large numbers visit specially during the feast. There are rows of houses to rent with many being just the building without beds and a number of them without toilets. One has to use common toilets and wash/bath areas. So renting these requires planning as one has to take everything. We booked one of the houses through a friend who knew a priest (as we are Buddhists, we didn't have any connections to the church nor knew much about the process). We were given a house number when we booked and asked to collect the keys from the office. When we went to the office we were given a key to a different house saying that was better! When asked for directions, all the information we got was that it's behind the church. The staff at the office were rude and did not show even an ounce of kindness. We were shocked at the treatment at this place of worship. After driving along a number of little lanes we found the house and when we opened it, it was damp and smelled of bats, and no toilet! As there were many empty houses around, we looked at some from outside and went back to the office to ask for one of the houses that had a toilet and shower facilities and said we are happy to pay more. But was refused point blank. We proceeded to Mannar where we were planning to go the next day. As a result we couldn't stay for the service 6.00pm service.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Madu shrine...one of most famouse church amoung catholics in sri lanka....affected during the war and now almost anyone can reach without any issue...almost crowded during the period church feast...for site lovers please avoid the month of august....

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: This place is popular among Roman Catholics, this place have long history and one of the must see place in the are

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Situated in vanni. Now open for civiliance since 2004 after a 30yrs of War. Lacks are participating for the church events. Long drive from Colombo. Minimum facilities available.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: A very spiritual place of historical religious significance. Very accessible on good road. A much visited Catholic shrine by people of all religious denominations

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: The Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu is a beautiful church close to Mannar. It's very populair, most of the Sri Lankan Christian people will visit it, especially during big events and holidays. We like this place.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Madhu Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu is a #Catholic church with a #history of over 400 years in #Northern #SriLanka. It is accessible both by train and road. The place is of veneration particularly to Catholics, but any given day there are Christians, Buddhists, Muslims and Hindus who come here to prey and receive blessings. For the pilgrims who intend staying overnight, there are Rooms and cottages to be rented from the Office of the Church.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: For Catholics and non Catholics who believes  in Mother Mary a church to worship. If you really need to see miracles 'visit the church in real belief' Mother Mary will instantly show a miracle.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: A must see place around Mannar. Good access road. Only 45 minutes from the turning point of the main road to return.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: A most reverent place in Mannar, Sri Lanka. All your prayers would be heard and would be fulfilled. You can stay at Mannar which is quite closeby.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: In off-season, there are nobody in the church except few believers. But when the main ceremony ongoing, LOTS of people come here to pray. At that time, this is well crowded. Big parking space, camping areas, ATM, water and toilets available.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu is one of the en-route destinations in the north of Sri Lanka, between Mannar and Jaffna. The history of this catholic church goes back for over 4 centuries. To safeguard the catholic mission this shring was kept in the jungle of Madhu. Now, itâ€™s being a very popular church and a most visited pilgrim among the catholic population around Sri Lanka. Also, visited by tourist regardless the religions, ethnics, nationalities  and so onâ€¦ The services/mass are conducted in both the native languages (Tamil & Sinhalese) in the mornings and the evenings. The special festival season is in August and the final festival is on the 15th of August. During this period the area is crowed and the church is filled with pilgrims, which makes the visit of the church a highly busy. So, better avoid this period to visit here. Pilgrims can rent accommodation around the church for a very reasonable price. Eating around is a challenge. (The food available in the canteen adjoining the church is not up to the mark and a bit over priced for what you get. But, itâ€™s a clean and comfortable place to sit and have something to eat.) Having a dip in to the fresh water pond closer to the church is possible and something interesting to do. NB: Im rating this land mark as excellent as Im a catholic and still believe and following the same.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: En route to Mannar we decided to take a fairly long detour to visit this place and discovered a small settlement of accommodation for visitors, market, hospital etc. In fact everything that might be found in a small town Compared to other cathedrals and churches elsewhere in Sri Lanka we found the religious buildings here quite underwhelming in terms of scale and architectural detail - and as we were not on a pilgrimage our visit did not last long Roman Catholics from all over Sri Lanka make the pilgrimage to the Shrine. When we visited there was a large contingent from the Negombo area which has a large RC population

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: By a good road you arrive easily at a large parking space to visit this beautiful church. When we came there the Sunday mass just started so we could not make any pictures from the inside. We did so from the nearby chapel. Everything is to visit for free and the outside placed statues/paintings from the death and resurrection of Jesus are very realistic en well placed to tell their story. Washrooms are not available: only the public ones, who are numerous but I do not recommend them at all.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: It is 10 Km off the main Medawachchiya-Mannar road. Not sure if public transport is available in the off-season. Can get very crowded during the festival times. Peaceful surroundings of the Madhu wildlife sanctuary provide meditative atmosphere. Recommend a visit to the nearby (on the other side of the main road) 'hanging bridge'.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Although I am a Buddhist, my mother is a Christian and hence took her to visit this sacred site. I understand that this is a much revered site which has withstood the civil war and the heavy fighting which had engulfed the area previously. The area is now safe and fully accessible by road. Since this road winds through a forest area, it is advisable that it not be used during the night due to the wild life in the area. I also saw a railway station nearby (about 10 Kms away). The Pope also visited this church during his recent visit to Sri Lanka.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: sri Lanka is one of the best travel locations to visit. This place has a wide range of scenic beauties to offer. This article will discuss about all these locations that it offers. This article will help you explain what to expect in Godâ€™s Own Country, Sri Lanka

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Nothing like I expected from stories iv heard from my mother!! Its quite commercialised and built up.  An easy walk from the car park to the church. Do not use the toilets they are awful.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Though there is not clear evidence as of when the church was built but for sure  there is a rich history underneath the magnificent church. It is know to host unbelievable number of people during the Its famous feast. Must visit place

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Shrine of our Lady of Madhu has a very ancient history ,and is visited by people of all faiths,it is surounded by the Madhu wild life sanctuary and a very calm and quite location you will always find some people here ,during the Madhu church feast it is fully crowded with people have been here many times hope the Madhu natural forest is not destroyed

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: I really enjoyed the drive through the forest reserve although the road was very bad. This is mainly good for people who wants to pray than sightseeing. (since I do not believe in anybody else other than myself, may be I am little bias) You do not find good toilets even at a fee. Parking is not an issue and a beautifully designed restaurant is available. However, we lost our appetite when we went in but it is moderately good.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: This is a must see site regardless of your religious beliefs. It is a large compound with holy ancient statues. About 45 minutes drive worth of visiting

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Visited with my family and though we are Buddhists ,we felt the  blessings of the shrine very much. Very calm, Quite and peaceful place and we lit candle for each member , wishing to enlighten our lives. About 08 kilometer we drive off Talaimannar - vavniya main road and reached there. advice to visit the place in a morning or evening. Area is generally dry and hot. Roads are all right. Shrine is very beautifully constructed and renovated. Avoid devotional season ( Heavily crowded ) to enjoy a peaceful visit.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: This is religious area has recently been refurbished for the visit of His Holiness the Pope. The main approach road from the Mannar Road is quite well done and is macadamised. However, the road from the west coast Mannar-Pooneryn Road is a dirt track road which is barely navigable. suggest that one avoids this route. The shrine itself is serene and worthy of respect.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: This was my second visit to madu shrine for Catholics in sri lanka and for others religious devotes this is place of great faith and peace . for many years the shrine of madu was unreachable but now people from all over sri Lankan come to this place for blessings

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Very popular hly place in Mannar. People from around the Sri Lanka visits here and celebrate annual function, often in September

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: I was able to pay a long standing vow to Our Blessed Mother and although the Mass was in Tamil/ Sinhala I was happy to participate , the Church was crowded , to see how so many people flock to this shrine from all corners of the Island says it all.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Madhu church is well developed now with all facilities. But the calm and holy surrounding which was there 30 to 40 yrs before , when we visited at our childhood is no more. Jungle is cleared. Vehicle access restricted and cement constructions are in plenty.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Visited after many years! Lovely surprise! Roads are done up well and the facilities are great! Arrival of Pope seem to be speeding things up!

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: super reach through madavachiya - if you want adventure go thru wilpathuwa national reserve. the roads are super for a adventure if you got a SUV

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: There are many stories surrounding Madhu church, but its generally easy to find and a nice place to visit. There's a cafeteria as well with some good food. A lot of people camp around the church, so we decided not to explore the rest rooms. BUt a definite must see if you're in the area.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: It is the same inner peace you receive when you go to The Shrine of Our Lady of Lourdes. People from all walks of life, religions come to pay homage to Our Lady of Madhu. Our family members and all who were at the Shrine were engaged in prayer.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: It's a very peaceful place and visited by many Christians and others as well. Lot of history and place to worship our Lady of Madu. You need to visit this church at least once

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Lot of Catholics come here to visit and is a pilgrimage to them and three persons who accompanies me had very special reason to visit Madhu and certain reasons to Pray for. It holds the Statue of Our Lady of Madhu and considered very powerful by Catholics.  We brought holy water and rosaries etc from there. You observe a lot of devotees visiting the place to make offerings for vows made or for special prayers.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: If you are Roman Catholic, this is the center of it all in Sri Lanka. If you're not particularly interested in religion, then it's a nice place to visit, but. The shrine itself is pretty enough, very well maintained (the Church is the largest landowner in the District, and one of the richest organizations on the island) and important as a critical battlefield site during the civil war. The raison d'etre is a small statue of the Virgin Mary, high atop the altar. The statue itself has a long and storied history in Sri Lanka, and so is famous. In-and-of-itself, it isn't much to look at, but then appearance is not what makes it importance. If you are Roman Catholic, or have a particular interest in Sri Lankan history and culture, you must visit the site. The casual tourist might be interested in stopping at Madhu for a half hour or so if passing through, but I wouldn't make it a goal. It all depends on your motivation for going.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Madhu Church is about 230km away from Colombo on Mannar - Vavuniya highway. The road is good after recent development work carried out by the  RDA. Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu is a Roman Catholic Marian shrine commonly called as Madhu church. This is a prominent worship place of Sri Lankan Catholics . There is a canteen in the madhu church premises food is tasty and spicy. There are lots of flies in the canteen. We had a big "?" mark regarding the hygiene factor of the food because of this enormous amount of flies. This is an very old church and believed to be a powerful worship place for both Sinhala and Tamil catholics for so many decades. We saw many devotees praying to mother when we were there. Annual festival is taking place in August and we were told the whole premises get crowded with many thousands of devotees at the annual festival. The devotees come for the festival used to stay for number of days and it could be the reason why there are so many flies.

Destination Title: Shrine of Our Lady of Madhu
Review Text: Last week we went to this church, it is in 10 KM from Mannar - Vavunia highway the road is good and very well done. It is a Catholic St. Mary Church. as usual it has all the appearance of a worship place. There is a canteen the food is very spicy but tastier, only issue is LOTS of flies (repeat LOTS of) may be we were after the festival. I am told there are places to stay and inexpensive but very very basic. There is enough public transport from Colombo and other main cities. This is an old and believed to be a powerful worship place, you could see many devotees praying to mother. If you are a catholic
